lead_paragraph: In Florida, Mrs. Clinton called for a more “inclusive economy” for a group of Americans who are too often “overlooked and undervalued.”

byline.contributor: Matt Flegenheimer reported from Orlando, and Amy Chozick from New York.
byline.original: By MATT FLEGENHEIMER and AMY CHOZICK

headline.print_headline: Clinton Views the Disabled as Key Allies
headline.main: Hillary Clinton Outlines Vision of More Job Opportunities for People With Disabilities

snippet: In Florida, Mrs. Clinton called for a more “inclusive economy” for a group of Americans who are too often “overlooked and undervalued.”...
abstract: Hillary Clinton appeals to voters with disabilities, who make up roughly one-sixth of electorate, during speech in Florida in which she outlines her previous policy work for demographic and discusses vision for 'inclusive economy' for often-overlooked constituency; move sharply contrasts with Donald Trump's much-criticized comments when he mocked New York Times reporter Serge F Kovaleski for his physical disability in 2015.
